text: Elena Nestorovna Mikhnenko (; 1922â€“1993) was the daughter of the Ukrainian anarchist revolutionaries Nestor Makhno and Halyna Kuzmenko. She was born in exile in Warsaw and she spent her early life in France. After the occupation of France, Mikhnenko was captured and forced into forced labour in Nazi Germany. She was later arrested by Soviet state security and then exiled her to the Kazakh Soviet Socialist Republic. ==Notes== ==References== Category:1922 births Category:1993 deaths Category:People from Warsaw Category:Prisoners of war
title: Elena Mikhnenko
